pageContext.claim: “He [Robert Mueller] wanted the FBI job. I don't know if anybody knows that, but as you know, he was considered for the FBI job, wanted it. And the day after he didn't get it, he became the special counsel. That's a conflict. And we had other things. But those are tremendous conflicts.”
pageContext.analysis: Special counsel Robert Mueller in his report contradicts the notion that he interviewed with Trump to be the FBI director. The report says: "As for Mueller's interview for FBI Director, [Steve] Bannon recalled that the White House had invited Mueller to speak to the President to offer a perspective on the institution of the FBI. Bannon said that, although the White House thought about beseeching Mueller to become Director again, he did not come in looking for the job." Career ethics officials in the Justice Department cleared Mueller to investigate Trump in May 2017.
